Description: A high-level attribute for grouping attributes into templates.
Label assigned to experimental data files indicating whether the data contained corresponds to a single or multiple biospecimens
High-level classification of the file content

The technology used to generate the data in this file. For multimodal datasets with concomitant profiling of biospecimen select all assays that apply. e.g., the GEX files from a CITE-seq experiment should be labeled with both 'scRNASeq' and 'CITESeq'.
Valid Values: Xenium, CosMX, GenePS SeqFISH, imaging mass cytometry, Visium, H&E, serial IHC

Description: Standard file format name or file extension
Valid Values: bai, bam, bed, bim, csv, czi, docx, dose, erate, fam, fastq, fcs, geojson, h5, h5ad, info, mcd, mtx, parquet, pdf, rds, rec, svs, tbi, tgz, tsv, txt, vcf, xls, xlsx, zip

Description: A distinct label or name, unique within an experiment, assigned to an imaging slides.
A unique identifier assigned to specimens collected from study participants. For multi-specimen data files provide all IDs in a comma-separated list.
A label further classifying the content of metadata resource.
Valid Values: single-cell metadata, cell coordinates, target panel, tissue microarray map, other

Description: A label used for file annotations to provide a brief description of the processed data file.
Valid Values: barcode counts, differential expression results, epigenomic peaks, gene counts

Description: Rds files store R objects, one per file. This label details the class of the R object saved to the Rds file or other similar file types.
Valid Values: ROCR prediction.object, Seurat object, SummarizedExperiment, Symphony reference, data.frame, list, matrix, sparse matrix, vector
